title: The best places to celebrate Diwali around the world
text:
Keep darkness at bay by lighting up the night skies. From Varanasi to Birmingham, here are the best Diwali celebrations around the world.

1. Flamboyant Jaipur

Diwali peaks on the third day of celebration, when the amavasya new moon appears (Oct 27 this year).

So if you want to experience the full flamboyance of the festival in India, there is still (just about) time to dash east.

Awesome Experiences (awesomeexperiences.com) sells a six-night “Diwali Festival of Light” trip that gazes at the temples and traditions of the Rajasthan capital Jaipur which still has space for last-minute travellers. From £1,392pp, flights extra (Oct 25–29, 2019).

2. Diwali in Edinburgh

It can be a regular complaint, as the nights draw in so oppressively, that there is nothing to brighten the evenings between Bonfire Night and Christmas. But this is literally not the case.
